sn2.3:1.2: Then, late at night, the glorious god Māgha, lighting up the entire Jeta’s Grove, went up to the Buddha, bowed, stood to one side,
sn2.3:1.3: and addressed the Buddha in verse:
sn2.3:2.1: “When what is incinerated do you sleep at ease?
sn2.3:2.2: When what is incinerated is there no sorrow?
sn2.3:3.1: “When anger’s incinerated you sleep at ease.
sn2.3:3.2: When anger’s incinerated there is no sorrow.
sn2.3:3.3: Vatrabhū, anger has a poisoned root,
sn2.3:3.5: The noble ones praise the slaying of anger,
sn2.3:3.6: for when it’s incinerated there is no sorrow.”
